children.description: Fires as a new color is displayed in the drop-down picker.  This isnot necessarily the "final" value; for example this event triggerswhen the sliders in the HSV selector are dragged, but then pressingESC would cancel the selection and the color will revert to theoriginal value.

Example - subscribe to the "change" event during initialization

children.description: Fires when a color was selected, either by clicking on it (in thesimple picker), by clicking ENTER or by pressing "Apply" in the HSVpicker.

children.name: enable

parameters.name: enable `Boolean` *(optional)*
parameters.description: Whether the widget should be enabled (`true`) or disabled (`false`). If not specified, the method will enable the widget.

children.description: Enables or disables the widget.

children.name: color

parameters.name: color `kendo.Color` *(optional)*
parameters.description: The color that should be set as the current value

children.description: Get or set the selected color. If no argument is given, this returns the currently selected color as a [`kendo.Color` object](/api/javascript/color).

children.name: value `String|Color` *(default: null)*
children.description: Get or set the selected color. If no argument is given, this returns thecurrently selected color as a string in format #FFFFFF when the `opacity`option is off, or rgba(255, 255, 255, 1) when `opacity` is requested.If one argument is given, it selects the new color and updates the UI.  Theargument can be a string in **hex**, **rgb** or **rgba** format, or a [Color][] object.This does not trigger the "change" event.

children.name: toggle
children.description: Toggles the popup.

children.name: open
children.description: Opens the popup element with the color selector.

children.name: close
children.description: Closes the popup.

children.name: value
children.description: The initially selected color.Note that when initializing the widget from an `<input>` element, the initial color will be decided by the field instead.

children.name: toolIcon
children.description: A CSS class name to display an icon in the color picker button. Ifspecified, the HTML for the element will look like this:

children.name: preview
children.description: Only applicable for the HSV selector.Displays the color preview element, along with an input field where the end user can paste a color in a CSS-supported notation.

children.name: opacity
children.description: Only for the HSV selector.  If `true`, the widget will display the opacity slider.Note that currently in HTML5 the `<input type="color">` does not support opacity.

children.name: palette
children.description: When a non-null `palette` argument is supplied, the drop-down will bea simple color picker that lists the colors. The following are supported:- "basic" -- displays 20 basic colors- "websafe" -- display the "web-safe" color palette- otherwise, pass a string with colors in HEX representation separated with  commas, or an array of colors, and it will display that palette instead.  If you pass an array it can contain strings supported by [parseColor][] or  [Color][] objects.If `palette` is missing or `null`, the widget will display the HSVselector.

children.name: messages
children.description: Allows localization of the strings that are used in the widget.

children.name: tileSize.width
children.description: The width of the color cell.

children.name: tileSize
children.description: The size of a color cell.

children.name: columns
Example - wrap list of colors on two rows with 3 columns

children.description: The number of columns to show in the color dropdown when a [`pallete`](#configuration-palette) is specified.This is automatically initialized for the "basic" and "websafe" palettes.If you use a custom palette then you can set this to some value that makes sense for your colors.

children.name: buttons
children.description: Specifies whether the widget should display the Apply / Cancel buttons.Applicable only for the HSV selector, when a [`pallete`](#configuration-palette) is not specified.
